intro: Maytenus pyraster, commonly known as the Brazilian tamarind or red tamarind, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
